events.title: Coronation of Athelstan
events.description: Athelstan was crowned as the first King of England, symbolizing the unification of various Anglo-Saxon kingdoms into one nation.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of a unified English monarchy, setting the foundation for the modern state of England.

events.title: Death of Nicolaus Copernicus
events.description: The Renaissance mathematician and astronomer, who formulated a heliocentric model of the universe, passed away.
events.significance: His work profoundly influenced the Scientific Revolution and changed humanity's understanding of the cosmos.

events.title: Battle of San Juan Hill
events.description: During the Spanish-American War, American forces led by Theodore Roosevelt captured San Juan Hill in Cuba.
events.significance: A decisive battle leading to American victory and increased U.S. influence in the Caribbean and Pacific.

events.title: The Hollywood Sign is inaugurated
events.description: The iconic Hollywood Sign was originally erected as an advertisement for a local real estate development titled 'Hollywoodland'.
events.significance: The sign became a symbol synonymous with the global film and entertainment industry.

events.title: The Mumbai train bombings
events.description: A series of coordinated bomb attacks on commuter trains in Mumbai, India, killed over 200 people and injured hundreds.
